entries.text: We are a growing software company using open source software/modern Perl practices to build innovative e-payment, auction, and tax collection web applications. We are looking for talented, motivated professionals committed to flawless work and customer service.
entries.title: We are Hiring a Senior Perl Software Developer - Grant Street Group

entries.author: brian_d_foy
entries.text: brian posted his thoughts on perl and recruitment, in response to Dave's post last week. Hard to distil down to a pithy one-liner, but here's one good soundbite: "Pay doesn't matter if you suck".
entries.title: My Perl recruitment thoughts

entries.author: curtis_ovid_poe
entries.text: ZipRecruiter is a job board startup based in California, and they're looking for Perl developers. A few people you might have heard of already work / contract there, and they allow remote work.
entries.title: ZipRecruiter Wants You

entries.author: pinkhas_nisanov
entries.text: Pinkhas introduces his new module Regexp::SAR, based on his own regexp engine, which lets him trigger events for multiple pattern matches. Written in C/XS.
entries.title: Matching regular expressions with events

entries.author: dave_rolsky
entries.text: Dave's released a trial version of Params::Validate, which allows validation callbacks to die in order to provide a custom error message or exception object. If you use it, he'd like you to test this version and report any problems please.
entries.title: Please Test Params::Validate 1.14

entries.author: yanick_champoux
entries.text: Yanick goes to town about his new craziness, Pod::Knit, which you can get from github for now. It involves pod, XML, sausages, knitting and dancing kittens. I made one of those up.
entries.title: Fun in POD-land

entries.author: miguel_prz
entries.text: Miguel Prz (NICEPERL)'s regular lists: Great modules released last week; MetaCPAN weekly report; StackOverflow Perl report.
entries.title: NICEPERL's lists

entries.author: brian_d_foy
entries.text: The Perl Foundation has announced the recipients for the 15th year of the White Camel Awards: Amalia Pomian for Perl community, VM Brasseur for Perl user groups, and Neil Bowers for Perl advocacy. Congratulations to Amalia and VM!
entries.title: The 2014 White Camel Awards

entries.text: The MetaCPAN project is taking on two interns, Rose Ames and Andreea Pirvulescu, as part of the GNOME outreach program for women.
entries.title: MetaCPAN Welcomes our Newest OPfW Interns

entries.author: jt_smith
entries.text: Michael McClennen gave a talk at MadMongers last week, about implementing web data services in Perl.
entries.title: Implementing web data services

entries.author: ron_savage
entries.text: Ron has released new versions of his GraphViz2::Marpa and GraphViz2::Marpa::PathUtils modules. Graphviz is the most widely used toolkit for displaying directed graphs, and Marpa::R2 is a modern parsing toolkit for Perl.
entries.title: A Note About Parsing Graphviz DOT files

entries.author: brian_d_foy
entries.text: brian would like to see the love child of Travis and CPAN Testers: getting CPAN Testers results when you push a new version of your distribution to github.
entries.title: CPAN Testers from Github?

entries.text: Alex is trying to create an Excel-style spreadsheet in Perl/Tk, and wonders if anyone else has tried such a thing.
entries.title: Perl/Tk Spreadsheet Editor

entries.author: sinan_unur
entries.text: Sinan presents more portability bugs he's found in Perl modules, and promises he'll submit patches.
entries.title: When bits don't stick

entries.author: timm_murray
entries.text: Setting up a hackerspace webcam using a RaspberryPi and Perl.
entries.title: A Hackerspace Webcam

entries.author: david_oswald
entries.text: YAPC::NA 2015 is in Salt Lake City, and the call for papers is now open. Your deadline is January 15th.
entries.title: YAPC::NA 2015 Call for papers

entries.author: brian_d_foy
entries.text: brian's notes from the hack day before Saint Perl. Note: brian's post isn't in Russian, but that other page is.
entries.title: Saint Perl 6 Hack Day wrap-up

entries.author: enkidu
entries.text: This is a great blog post. Enkidu shares his enthusiasm for learning about Mojolicious from Glen Hinkle's Mojocasts. What in the Perl world makes you happy? Blog about it!
entries.title: Thank You, Glen Hinkle!

entries.author: sawyer_x
entries.text: In addition to all his advent posts, Sawyer announced a new release of Dancer 2. I'm starting to suspect that Sawyer is the name of a collective in Amsterdam.
entries.title: New Dancer2 release

entries.author: david_oswald
entries.text: David and INGY have been wrapping up their work on the Inline grant. Inline::CPP support is now working well across varied platforms, Module::Build based distributions are now supported, and a lot of testing/debugging has taken place.
entries.title: Inline Grant Weekly Report #9

entries.text: Dave Mitchell's monthly report for his work on the Perl 5 core, funded by a grant. The main item of note was his awesome work on a benchmarking tool.
entries.title: Maintaining the Perl 5 Core

entries.text: A range of topics, and not just from Mark: MetaCPAN::Client, Code::TidyAll, Test::Requires, Data::ICal::DateTime, Capture::Tiny, Struct::Dumb, App::ack.
entries.title: The Perl 5 Advent Calendar

entries.text: Quoting on Steroids, Three strange loops, MoarVM Internals for the Brave (and Curious), Snow white and the seven conditionals, Helping Santa with Roles, Community smoke testing. Bioinformatics and the joy of Perl 6,
entries.title: The Perl 6 Advent Calendar

entries.text: Seven more articles on the Catalyst web framework: Porting Reddit's URL Structure to Catalyst Using Chaining, Instant database admin tool with RapidApp and rdbic.pl, The Plack::App::RapidApp::rDbic interface to RapidApp, Redispatching to a public path, Another Take on redispatching, Application-wide access to the context ($c) for the impatient, The Future of Catalyst, or the Fifty Year Framework.
entries.title: Catalyst Advent Calendar

entries.text: Seven more articles from Sawyer on the Dancer web framework: Outreach Program for Women (OPW) and Dancer, Command line dancing, Hidden feature: Auto Pages, The method of the setup method, Authentication for the masses, Meddling with Middlewares, Middlewared Dancer: our usage of middlewares.
entries.title: Dancer Advent Calendar

entries.text: Five more mini reviews from Matt Trout: Distribution building, Object orientation, SOAP, Exporting, Email.
entries.title: mstpan

entries.text: Seven more of Perlancar's modules released in 2014: App::shcompgen, Proc::Find, File::Unsaved, App::plstrace, Test::WithDB, String::Wildcard::Bash.
entries.title: Perlancar's advent calendar

entries.author: gabor_szabo
entries.text: A collection of Perl Maven articles about PSGI, the interface for writing modern web applications in Perl.
entries.title: PSGI the superglue between Perl web application frameworks and web servers

entries.title: How to set default values in Perl

header: Olaf and the MetaCPAN project are taking on two more interns for the GNOME outreach program for women. Thank you Olaf & Co.
The White Camel Awards for 2014 were announced this week, and I was humbled.
If you're celebrating any kind of holiday in the coming week, have a good one!
subject: Outreach program for women
